title: Help me find import export tools
content: Tools > ImportExportTools NG > Import MBOX file, select the 2GB MBOX file [web:4].

title: I can not send out emails from Thunderbird.
content: I can not send out emails from Thunderbird. I get the following message "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.xxxx.ca timed out. Try again." I have not been able to find an answer to this problem. I hope you can help. Please note I am a Senior so please be patient with me. Thanks, Al
creator: retired_cga

title: Importing emails contained in a DAT file
content:
I am trying to transition from Microsoft Outlook to Thunderbird. An essential part of the puzzle that needs to be solved is how to migrate the many emails from Outlook into Thunderbird.

In Outlook, I can select several emails and forward them to myself, but they are bundled in a file with extension DAT. Outlook has no trouble understanding the contents of the DAT file, but Thunderbird only sees a file it doesn't know what to do with.

Is there perhaps an addon for Thunderbird that can parse the DAT file contents into individual messages?
creator: tpgettys

title: Reply All to Sent Message Disappearing
content: Hello, I reply all to sent messages so that the details of the previous email are on my mail and my additions to it (new email) are on top, with the same addressees so they don't have to be added again/aren't missed. This has worked for years with the sent message going in SENT I recently updated Thunderbird and now the sent messages have disappeared. Is this a me/user error or has something changed? And how can I make sure it works like it used to? Best wishes Tim

title: error message 500 "something went wrong"

New emails aren't coming through on my computer, nor can I delete existing emails. I can however still send and receive on my phone, which is weird.
creator: tash2

title: Thunderbird seems to modifiy local files, even if not obviously changed
content:
This is an annoyance rather than an issue.

I run Thunderbird as my email and I archive old mail to local folders, which I want to sync to Dropbox.

This works fine, and I have a suitable set of .MSF files (over 100, 000) synced to Dropbox.

BUT. Every now and then (not sure how often, I see dropbox is syncing ALL my thunderbird files, even if they have not been changed.

Can anyone explain how Dropbox determines when to sync?

Is it possible that for some reason Thunderbird does something to the files (for no apparent reason)?

I have also asked the Dropbox forum what is the trigger for a file to be updated in Dropbox.

Thanks, Paul
creator: PaulGButlerUK

title: Disappearing messages
content: Good morning. I have an organization's IMAP account. Some accounts, sporadically and irregularly, are not receiving messages in their inbox. After logging in to the server via the website, I can see that they exist. Repairing them from the context menu didn't help. Where should I look for the cause? Details are in the attached graphic.

title: Unable to change font color using "Text color" window, "Choose a color" button (macOS)
content:
Changing color of the text during composing an email does not work when I use "Choose a color" button. The color in the button changes, but when I click "Ok" the color does not change. The color change works though if: I click "Last-picked color", or when I type color name "Green" or HTML hex, and subsequently click "OK".

How to change the color of text in a composed email when

I am using Thuderbird on macOS.

When trying to run in Safe Mode, and compose a new message, I the Thunderbird stucks, so I cannot confirm in Safe Mode, but I had this issue in the past also on other machines/Thunderbird instances, so maybe someone else had a similar problem, or maybe it is a known issue, already in dev team logs.
creator: cereberusjm

title: herinstalatie thunderbird
content:
Na een computercrah heb ik het windows besturingssysteem opnieuw geinstalleerd. Bij het opnieuw installeren van thunderbird krijg ik de melding dat ' de authenticatie is mislukt' of dat de server (hotmail) niet bereikt kan worden. Voorheen heeft Thunderbird altijd gewerkt met het hotmailadres. Nu niet meer en kan ik mijn mail alleen nog maar in de browser openen. Wat kan ik doen om Thunderbird weer te kunnen gebruiken?

Groet, Johan

title: Inbox randomly emptied , permanent deletion
content: Out of the blue, my inbox emptied and the messages were nowhere to be found. My email provider took a few days but recovered them from the servers, but shortly after it happened again. Their tech team said it was an erroneous message from Thunderbird (one of several apps that caused this, they said, not targetting Mozilla specifically). They suggested I switch to Outlook, which I have done but I miss Thunderbird, it's so much better. Any way I can return but guard against these raids? If you are kind enough to advise me, please be aware I am very non tech.....

title: Search with Quick Filter not working
content:
I'm trying to understand why the Quick Search (which I use all the time and is generally *amazing*) is not working for one specific email. The sender is "Marlene Hulda". I have attached the following screenshots:

1. A screenshot of my Inbox showing the email, along with a few others 2. A search using the word "Marlene". That search results in "no message found". 3. A search using the word "Hulda". That search results in "no message found". 4. A search using the word "welcome". In this case, it does find the email.

Any suggestions on why it cannot find the email in step 2 or step 3?

Thanks for your help.
creator: queenmab100
